transcript.text: quotes by linguist and philosopher n
chamski Nong chamski is a linguist and
philosopher born in the United States in
1928 he laid the foundation for modern
Linguistics by exploring the universal
structures and principles of language he
was also known for his political
activism and his critical views on Power
and the media this quote was delivered
in his book American power and the new
mandarins published in
1970 the meaning of this quote is that
freedom is not simply following one's
own desires but choosing and acting on
what one thinks is right this quote is
for those who find it difficult to live
according to their own will and values
it means that those who are able to
stand up for their beliefs without
succumbing to the pressures and
temptations of society Authority and the
media are truly free
people
